text: It's the little things that are important. Little things make big things happen.
author: John Wooden

text: I never lose. I either win or learn.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: My thoughts become clear when expressed through speech or writing.
author: Dawson Trotman

text: Effort surpasses talent. Talent is meaningless without effort.
author: Unknown

text: The only person you should strive to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
author: Unknown

text: The key to success is the courage to act and the resilience to accept failure.
author: Unknown

text: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Only those who risk going too far can discover how far they can go.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
author: Helen Keller

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: True nobility is being superior to your former self.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: You grow up the day you have your first real laugh at yourself.
author: Ethel Barrymore

text: Gentleness is the strongest force in the world.
author: Han Suyin

text: Everyone who has taken a shower has had an idea. It's the person who gets out of the shower, dries off, and does something about it who makes a difference.
author: Nolan Bushnell

text: A successful person is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at them.
author: David Brinkley

text: All progress takes place outside the comfort zone.
author: Michael John Bobak

text: Mystery creates wonder, and wonder is the basis of man's desire to understand.
author: Neil Armstrong

text: If you want to be happy, be.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Optimism is true moral courage.
author: Ernest Shackleton

text: He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to stand and walk and run and climb and dance; one cannot fly into flying.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Success comes before work only in the dictionary.
author: Vidal Sassoon

text: Strive only to be a better person than you were yesterday.
author: Unknown

text: Believe and act as if it were impossible to fail.
author: Charles Kettering

text: Peace is not the absence of conflict, but the ability to constructively manage it.
author: Unknown

text: Every day, you can take a small step in the right direction.
author: Unknown

text: Some of the most wonderful things in life are unseen, which is why we close our eyes when we kiss, cry, and dream.
author: Unknown

text: Beyond the clouds, there is a bright blue sky.
author: Unknown

text: Storms don't last forever.
author: Unknown

text: If the grass is greener on the other side, it might be because you aren't taking care of your own grass.
author: Unknown

text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Do what is right, not what is easy nor what is popular.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Believing in yourself is the first step to success. If you don't believe in yourself, no one else will.
author: Unknown

text: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

text: Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.
author: James Baldwin

text: Your actions speak louder than your words.
author: Unknown

text: The greatest adventure in life is living your dreams.
author: Unknown

text: There are no shortcuts to success. Every failure is a stepping stone forward.
author: Unknown

text: Life won't pause while you gather courage to act.
author: Unknown

text: The most difficult times are when you must not give up. That is when the opportunity for success arises.
author: Unknown

text: .True understanding begins only when you experience shared suffering.
author: "Naruto Shippuden" Nagato (Pain)

text: If you see someone without a smile, give them yours.
author: Dolly Parton

text: Getting over pain is like crossing monkey bars: you must let go to move forward.
author: Unknown

text: Every finish line is the starting point of your next journey.
author: Unknown

text: The pain you endure today forges the strength you'll wield tomorrow.
author: Unknown

text: The coward dies a thousand deaths… but the brave? They die unseen.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: There are two types of pain in life: the pain of discipline and the pain of regret. Discipline weighs ounces, but regret weighs tons.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Consistent small acts of intentional kindness create waves of lasting change.
author: Unknown

text: Human limits are illusions until tested. Yours lie further than you think.
author: Unknown

text: Dip your hand in water, then remove it—the space you occupied vanishes instantly. So it is with human indispensability.
author: Unknown

text: Technology is like fish. The longer it stays on the shelf, the less desirable it becomes.
author: Andrew Heller

text: A scientist peers into nature's hidden chambers, driven by insatiable curiosity to unravel her secrets.
author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

text: We draft our life's manuscript daily—yet too few dare rewrite the painful chapters.
author: Unknown

text: Fear sharpens the mind, but cowardice paralyzes the soul.
author: Unknown

text: Art imitates not the mere form, but the inner truth of existence.
author: Aristotle

text: Perfection is a desert where creativity dies of thirst.
author: Salvador Dali

text: The real victory isn't in the score — it's in earning the right to compete.
author: Mike Singletary

text: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with undimmed resolve.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Education is the only valid passport from poverty.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

text: The question of whether machines can think is as irrelevant as whether submarines can swim.
author: Edsger Dijkstra

text: Clean code is a love letter to the next developer who will maintain it.
author: Unknown

text: Compassion is the best medicine for both mental and physical health.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Walking is the best medicine, and the oldest one too.
author: Hippocrates

text: Art is the ability to make the invisible visible.
author: Paul Klee

text: Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep.
author: Scott Adams

text: In football, we don’t just remember the wins — we cherish the battles.
author: Bill Shankly

text: Sports mirror life's journey—triumphs, setbacks, and the bonds forged in between.
author: Unknown

text: The purpose of education is not to fill an empty mind but to free an open one.
author: Malcolm Forbes

text: Logic will get you from A to B, but imagination will take you anywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The path less traveled, though strewn with stones, guides us to vistas unseen.
author: Unknown

text: Knowledge grows by accumulation, wisdom by elimination—discard illusions to see truth.
author: Unknown

text: True artists are alchemists — transforming inner visions into tangible beauty.
author: Unknown

text: Creativity begins by overcoming fear.
author: Unknown

text: You only discover your limits when you dare to risk falling.
author: Unknown

text: To teach is to learn twice.
author: Joseph Joubert

text: While you are afraid to change, the world is evolving.
author: Unknown

text: Failure is tuition paid for success's diploma — keep learning, keep earning.
author: Unknown

text: Success isn't a place on a map — it's the wisdom etched into your soul by the journey.
author: Unknown

text: Losing's acceptable — what's unforgivable is letting defeat dictate your next move.
author: "Haikyuu!!" Shoyo Hinata

text: True discovery lies not in new observations, but in new thoughts about old truths.
author: Schopenhauer/Szent-Györgyi

text: Even the darkest night has stars that shine.
author: Unknown

text: Do not fear failure. It is the first step toward success.
author: Unknown

text: Fear deafens the soul's whispers—listen through the silence of courage.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: The value of life is not measured by what you receive, but by what you give.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Courage is acting while feeling fear.
author: Unknown

text: Learning is the result of small daily efforts.
author: Unknown

text: On match day, you only access what you stored in training.
author: Eric Cantona

text: He who has health has hope, and he who has hope has everything.
author: Owen Arthur

text: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Education is not about emptying the mind but about freeing it.
author: Robert Frost

text: Sports do not build character; they reveal it.
author: Heywood Broun

text: A single flap of a butterfly’s wings can stir a hurricane—so too can one act ignite global change.
author: Unknown

text: Success is no accident. It is born of effort, patience, and learning.
author: Pele

text: The harder you work, the luckier you get.
author: Gary Player

text: The last of human freedoms is the ability to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances.
author: Viktor Frankl

text: Creativity takes courage.
author: Henri Matisse

text: Design is not just what it looks like; it's how it works.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Failure is an option. If you’re not failing, you’re not innovating enough.
author: Elon Musk

text: Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.
author: Henry Ford

text: We cannot become what we need to be by remaining what we are.
author: Max De Pree

text: Imagination is the only boundary between you and the impossible.
author: Unknown

text: 'Impossible' is either a wall or a springboard — your choice redefines life.
author: Takuya Kimura

text: Seek reasons to persist, not excuses to quit.
author: Kazuyoshi Miura

text: Balance intensity with ease — but never ease up on intensity.
author: Koshi Inaba (B'z)

text: In despair, we feel isolated—yet our deepest scars birth profound empathy.
author: Tsuyoshi Domoto

text: Effort builds invisible bridges — destiny names them opportunity.
author: Takashi Okamura

text: The only doping I ever did was hard work.
author: Diego Maradona

text: Daily self-conquest — pushing limits, battling doubts — forges dreamers into achievers.
author: J.Y.Park

text: Tension is growing pain — embrace it as life sculpting your best self.
author: ROLAND

text: What defines a life well-lived is the depth of one's compassion.
author: Ken Takakura

text: Speak your truth boldly — if doors close, pivot with humor to new horizons.
author: Atsugiri Jason

text: True courage lies not in persistence, but in discerning when to redirect your energy.
author: Hugh Laurie

text: Strength blooms when you acknowledge the edges of your potential.
author: Keanu Reeves

text: Kindness is the light that outshines life's darkest corners.
author: Robin Williams

text: Discipline fuels dreams — it’s the bridge between vision and victory.
author: Will Smith

text: Action without design is noise — commit to intentional creation.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The most important thing in life is to live according to your own values, not the expectations of others.
author: Stevie Wonder

text: Failures are tuition payments for mastery’s diploma.
author: LeBron James

text: Realism tames potential — extraordinary lives demand unreasonable dreams.
author: Will Smith

text: Success isn’t a sprint — it’s a marathon where persistence outpaces raw talent.
author: Dax Shepard

text: If you pray for rain, you have to deal with the mud too. That's part of it.
author: Denzel Washington

text: The greatest rebellion is proving the impossible possible.
author: James Baldwin

text: True strength is forged in the fires of adversity — each challenge a crucible for growth.
author: Leonardo DiCaprio

text: Dreams don't become reality through magic. They take sweat, determination, and hard work.
author: Colin Powell

text: It's never too late to reinvent yourself.
author: Steve Harvey

text: Pain is unavoidable. It's a perfect opportunity for growth.
author: Romany Malco

text: Critics are the compass pointing to success’s true north.
author: Malcolm X

text: As long as they spell your name right, don't worry about bad publicity.
author: Clark Gable

text: Be the change you wish to see — legacy is built by those who dare to act.
author: Barack Obama

text: Your self - worth is determined by you. You don't need anyone's validation to define your value.
author: Beyoncé

text: Never let others steer your dreams — ignite your own fire and chase what sets your soul ablaze.
author: Rihanna

text: Strength isn't just in muscles — it's the resilience to shatter ceilings and own your legacy.
author: Serena Williams

text: True freedom blooms when you confront fears and embrace your most authentic self.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Kindness in the face of storms becomes the legacy that outshines temporary battles.
author: Taylor Swift

text: Wholeness lies in embracing every scar and strength — they're the mosaic of your humanity.
author: Alicia Keys

text: Failure isn't a full stop — it's the comma that leads to your next bold chapter.
author: Queen Latifah

text: Your worth is a sonic universe — amplify it fearlessly in a world tuned to monotony.
author: Björk

text: The ultimate rebellion? Choosing your dreams over society's scripted fantasies.
author: Lady Gaga

text: Perfection is a boring myth — my power lies in the raw, unfiltered notes of my journey.
author: Adele

text: Confronting fear isn’t about condoning violence — it’s about exposing truths to spark redemption.
author: Kathryn Bigelow

text: Art saved me from suicide — it’s the weapon I wield to turn hallucinations into hope.
author: Yayoi Kusama

text: Stories make us feel seen — craft yours relentlessly, for they ripple through generations.
author: Greta Gerwig

text: You’re so enough it’s unbelievable — own that truth louder than anyone’s doubt.
author: Lizzo

text: Turn your melancholy into melody — there’s power in the poetry of imperfection.
author: Lana Del Rey

text: One book, one pen, one girl — ignite a revolution that outshines extremism.
author: Malala Yousafzai

text: In a world that demands conformity, your uniqueness is the script only you can write.
author: Meryl Streep

text: When they try to shrink your light, shine brighter — your power lies in unwavering integrity.
author: Michelle Obama

text: Loving yourself is the beginning of everything.
author: Lucille Ball

text: Your vote is your voice — wield it fiercely to protect democracy’s fragile flame.
author: Kamala Harris

text: Women are already strong — feminism’s mission is to shift how the world perceives that strength.
author: G.D. Anderson

text: Rebel against society’s scripts — your authenticity is your ultimate artwork.
author: Lady Gaga

text: Yesterday is but today's memory, and tomorrow is today's dream.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Develop a passion for learning. If you do, you will never cease to grow.
author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

text: Without you, my life doesn't seem real. It only becomes real when you're there, becoming part of my life, and when I'm sharing it with you.
author: Gilmore Girls

text: Each dawn writes a new chapter — yesterday’s wisdom can’t decode today’s riddles.
author: Because This Is My First Life

text: Every encounter is a universe colliding — their past, present, and future now orbit yours.
author: Because This Is My First Life

text: Happiness isn’t in grand events — it’s in sunlit classrooms and scribbled notes we overlooked.
author: Our Beloved Summer

text: When running, maintaining your pace is very important. If it's hard, you can slow down. Just don't give up. As an adult, you can do that much, right?
author: Run On

text: Tides ebb and flow—cling not to what recedes, but dance with what washes ashore.
author: Because This Is My First Life

text: The moments I spent with you were shining. Because the weather was good, because the weather was bad, and because the weather was good enough. I loved every moment.
author: When the Weather is Fine

text: Good things sometimes happen to good people too.
author: Hospital Playlist S2

text: Emotions are like living things. If you ignore them, they grow out of control. Especially hatred. It continues to grow, feeding on memories.
author: More Than Friends

text: Being bad at something is just the first step to being a little better at it.
author: Adventure Time

text: Not everything is a lesson. Sometimes you just fail.
author: The Office

text: Don't give up hope just because it seems hopeless! You need to hope even more!
author: Futurama

text: Strength is about fighting. It's hard and it hurts and it's every day. It's what we have to do, and we can do it together.
author: Buffy the Vampire Slayer

text: Don't apologize, just be confident.
author: RuPaul's Drag Race

text: Never forget what you are. The world will not. Wear it like armor, and it can never be used to hurt you.
author: Game of Thrones

text: When traveling, people accept everything. They leave their anger at home.
author: Elias Canetti

text: Nothing evokes childlike wonder like being in a country where you know almost nothing. Suddenly, you feel like a five-year-old again.
author: Bill Bryson

text: Maybe you need to leave a place to truly miss it.
author: Jodi Picoult

text: The essence of human nature is to come together.
author: The Walking Dead

text: More is lost by indecision than by wrong decisions.
author: The Sopranos

text: Sometimes, knowing which bridges to cross and which to burn is the most difficult thing in life.
author: The International

text: Experience is a harsh teacher. First comes the test, then the lesson.
author: The Crown

text: Any man who must say 'I am the king' is no true king.
author: Game of Thrones

text: If you work hard, you'll be rewarded someday. If not, either your way of working is wrong or your employer is. In that case, you should just get out of there.
author: Natsuzora

text: The things you really want to know in life aren't on the internet! That's the point!
author: Overprotective Kahoko

text: No matter how tough it gets, make sure you sleep well, eat well, and don't let go of the hand of the person you love.
author: Overprotective Kahoko

text: There's no mother who doesn't have regrets in raising children. In the end, you just have to be prepared. Believe that even if your child falls, they will get up. It's harder to believe than to love.
author: Overprotective Kahoko

text: What's important is gratitude and giving back. A future without these two is just a selfish daydream.
author: Hanzawa Naoki

text: There are times when you can only think about yourself.
author: There's a Limit to Inappropriateness!

text: Those kids will create the future 30 or 40 years from now.
author: There's a Limit to Inappropriateness!

text: There isn't just one truth. There are as many truths as there are people. But there's only one 'fact'.
author: Don't Call It Mystery

text: Instead of complaining about the darkness, you should be the one to light a candle.
author: Mother Teresa

text: To live is not to breathe, but to act.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

text: You have to change your own world.
author: Nodame Cantabile

text: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: Everything you want is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

text: Feeling lazy can lead to finding better ways to do things.
author: Unknown

text: Before thinking too much, gather information and find someone who has already succeeded.
author: Unknown

text: Without facts and data, it’s not a real opinion.
author: Unknown

text: 'I’m stupid'—saying this as an excuse will make you believe it and stop trying.
author: Unknown

text: Debate is about sharing ideas and proving your logic to others.
author: Unknown

text: Make sure your effort is in the right direction, so it doesn’t turn into wasted struggle.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t give up on what you can’t do. Use what you can do to make up for it.
author: Unknown

text: If your opinion has weak points, others won’t see it as a real opinion.
author: Unknown

text: Admitting your lack of skill and reflecting on it is already a big step toward growth.
author: Unknown

text: If you have no skills, you won’t care. But with average skills, you might focus only on what you can do and feel overconfident.
author: Unknown

text: I have no talent. That’s why I must become stronger.
author: Unknown

text: So work hard, learn, and gain experience.
author: Unknown

text: I don’t have time to doubt myself because I have no talent.
author: Unknown

text: If sacrifice is needed, I won’t hesitate to make it.
author: Unknown

text: Time cannot be bought with money. Just do what you can.
author: Unknown

text: You feel like giving up? It happens to everyone.
author: Unknown

text: Curiosity is what matters. If you have curiosity, you’ll be fine.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t get angry at your age. It’s not worth it.
author: Unknown

text: Anger only brings harm. It shortens your life and makes no one feel good. Patience is a virtue.
author: Unknown

text: People who discriminate based on status or position are not smart. Logic doesn’t work on them.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t just criticize. If you say something isn’t interesting, explain what is.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t be the kind of person who does nothing but complains. Take responsibility for your words.
author: Unknown

text: When you fail and inconvenience others, you lose something important: trust. Nothing is more valuable in relationships.
author: Unknown

text: Even if you’re forgiven for failing, trust is still lost. Think of it as someone trading their trust to forgive your failure.
author: Unknown

text: When trust is lost, it’s easy to focus on your mistakes. But to regain trust, focus on the good qualities that earned it before.
author: Unknown

text: ‘Oh well, that’s just me.’ Even your weaknesses are chances to grow. Keep going until you can accept them.
author: Unknown

text: If you make a mistake, let others correct you. Learn from it and use that knowledge next time.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t rely only on motivation—make it a habit.
author: Unknown

text: People who joke around under stress are often hiding their lack of confidence.
author: Super Girl

text: There’s no need for power struggles. As women, we can be tough and smart, and work toward peace through discussion.
author: Super Girl

text: Don’t worry. You decide your destiny. There’s no right answer in life. Even if you lose your way, what matters is not losing yourself. Be wise, be strong, and live honestly.
author: Super Girl

text: I gave you the chance to build a kingdom, but you wasted it sleeping. Do you know how much I sleep? Two hours.
author: Super Girl

text: I want to live to the fullest. Every day, I want to achieve something, even if it’s small. Don’t be lazy.
author: Super Girl

text: It’s ridiculous. You won’t find your calling online. Your true purpose is within yourself. Supergirl isn’t a hero because she can fly—it’s because she’s needed.
author: Super Girl

text: Look within yourself. Find out what you should do in life. Don’t rely on silly online quizzes.
author: Super Girl

text: Most people spend much of their time alone. That’s why, when tragedy strikes, they seek not just rescue but also comfort and stability.
author: Super Girl

text: You seem like you’re about to give up. But it happens to everyone. Talk to a doctor and get antidepressants—they can help.
author: Super Girl

text: I can’t just comfort you and say it’s okay. It’s not easy, but it’s not impossible. Reflect, rise again, and make your failure meaningful. It takes time, but you can regain the trust of the town. I believe in you.
author: Super Girl

text: You don’t gain power to achieve something. You seek and use power because you want to achieve something. Your will is too weak.
author: Unknown

text: If you don’t know something, look it up yourself. No one will help you. Search online—don’t be someone who always asks others for answers.
author: Unknown

text: 'Ask-for-help people' are those who always want others to do things for them because they don’t want to do it themselves.
author: Unknown

text: The walls you overcome will become the walls that protect you when you look back.
author: Unknown

text: Failure isn’t the problem—it’s the belief that you can’t do it. Losing courage is the real issue.
author: Unknown

text: ‘The process matters more than the result’—adults realize this is a lie. People only care about results.
author: Unknown

text: Make promises to yourself, trust yourself, and keep those promises. That’s how true confidence is built.
author: Unknown

text: Set goals you can achieve. Continuing to make an effort is about keeping promises to yourself.
author: Unknown

text: 'I have no talent' or 'I’m just ordinary'—saying these means you’re okay with staying the same and avoiding effort.
author: Unknown

text: If you think ‘I can’t do it because it’s risky,’ it probably means it’s not worth doing. If you’re not willing to give up what you have, then that’s the truth.
author: Unknown

text: People who make excuses and don’t act are just wasting time. But for them, it might feel logical.
author: Unknown

text: Saying you lack experience and confidence is just an excuse to protect your pride and avoid change. What good comes from finding reasons you can’t do something?
author: Unknown

text: Overthinking makes you miss opportunities. Even asking someone out becomes harder when you overthink.
author: Unknown

text: Humans are weak. We all make excuses to comfort ourselves. Losing hurts, but the pain fades after losing again and again.
author: Unknown

text: Do your best, even if you expect to lose. That’s what separates winners from losers.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t rely on others before taking the first step yourself.
author: Unknown

text: Think about whether doing this will harm you. If not, act first and regret later—it’s better than doing nothing.
author: Unknown

text: You can't go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: Be like a tree and shed your dead leaves: Let go of what's unnecessary and past attachments, and focus on new growth.
author: Rumi

text: When life gives you lemons, make lemonade: Even when faced with difficulties and adversity, you must transform them into something positive.
author: American Proverb

text: Close some doors today. Not because of pride, incapacity or arrogance, but simply because they lead nowhere: Unfruitful relationships and efforts need to be cut off with courage.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced: Rather than trying to solve life's problems, it's important to accept them as experiences.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

text: Don't bite the hand that feeds you: You should be grateful to those who help you and not cause them harm.
author: English Proverb

text: In life, you get what you have the courage to ask for: It's important to take active steps toward your desires and goals.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Better safe than sorry: By acting cautiously in advance, you can prevent regret.
author: English Proverb

text: Curiosity killed the cat: Excessive curiosity or prying can sometimes lead to danger, so caution is necessary.
author: English Proverb

text: Life is like a camera: Focus on the good times, develop from the negatives, and if things don't work out, take another shot.
author: Unknown

text: Mistakes are proof that you are trying: Continuing to challenge yourself without fear of failure leads to growth.
author: Unknown

text: Don't count your chickens before they hatch: Be careful not to have excessive expectations or make too many plans before results are in.
author: English Proverb

text: Failure is not the opposite of success. It's part of success: Failure is a process toward success and should be accepted rather than avoided.
author: Unknown

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take: Taking action is essential for success.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Life isn't about waiting for the storm to pass, but learning to dance in the rain: Even in difficult situations, it's important to find joy and live positively.
author: Unknown

text: Nothing is impossible. The word itself says 'I'm possible!': Just as 'I'm possible' is found within the word 'impossible', it's important to believe in the possibility of things that seem impossible.
author: Audrey Hepburn
